Sequence Information.Peptide Name: chCATH-B1 (Cath-B1, Chicken cathelicidin-B1, cathelicidin B1, natural AMPs; birds, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: the epithelium of the bursa of Fabricius,Gallus gallus

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: Warning: the cleavage site to release the mature peptide is unknown. The synthetic peptide is presumably corresponding to the mature peptide.Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 2..5 uM), S. aureus (MIC 1.25 uM), and P. aeruginosa (MIC 0.63 uM) (see the ref). CATH-B1) could inhibit Pseudorabies virus (PRV) (Ye et al., 2023).MOA:virus: similar to human cathelicidin against Zika virus, it directly Interact with the virus and TLR4/JNK/IRF3-Mediated Interferon Activation.Updated 11/2024
Literature Information.Author: Goitsuka R et al Cooper MD2007
Literature Information.Title: Chicken cathelicidin-B1, an antimicrobial guardian at the mucosal M cell gateway
